map.name: default
map.item:
In this experiment, you will see a series of stimuli presented one at a time (each stimulus may consist of one or several letters). Your task is to identify which of two possible stimuli is presented on screen, and press the corresponding button as quickly as possible.
If you see [LEFT_STIM], press the LEFT mouse button as quickly as possible.
If you see [RIGHT_STIM], press the RIGHT mouse button as quickly as possible.
Here is the catch: occasionally, when a stimulus appears, it will be followed by [STOP_STIM]. [STOP_STIM] is like a stop sign: when you see it, you should not respond. Do not wait to see whether [STOP_STIM] appears before you respond! Instead, try to respond as quickly as possible whenever a stimulus is shown to you. However, if the stop signal appears before you have responded, then stop your response. The stop signal will sometimes appear very late, and other times very quickly. Thus, you may sometimes make incorrect responses, and that is OK. It is more important that you respond somewhat quickly rather than slowing down to respond correctly.
As a reminder: if you see [LEFT_STIM], press the left mouse button. If you see [RIGHT_STIM], press the right mouse button. If [STOP_STIM] appears, then stop your response if you can.
Press either mouse button to begin when you are ready.
